description: Perform element-wise exponentiation of two tuples. Each element in the first tuple is raised to the power of the corresponding element in the second tuple.
input_format: Two lines containing space-separated integers. The first line represents the first tuple, the second line represents the second tuple.
output_format: A single line containing space-separated integers representing the resulting tuple after exponentiation.
prompt:
; Perform element-wise exponentiation of two tuples. Each element in the first tuple is raised to the power of the corresponding element in the second tuple.
; Input format: Two lines containing space-separated integers. The first line represents the first tuple, the second line represents the second tuple.
; Output format: A single line containing space-separated integers representing the resulting tuple after exponentiation.

#lang racket
completions:
(define (element-wise-exponentiation tuple1 tuple2)
  (map (lambda (x y) (expt x y)) tuple1 tuple2))

;; Example usage:
;; (element-wise-exponentiation (list 2 3) (list 4 5))
;; Expected output: (16 243)

(define (element-wise-exponentiation tuple1 tuple2)
  (map (lambda (x y) (expt x y)) tuple1 tuple2))

(define (main)
  (let ([tuple1 (read)]
        [tuple2 (read)])
    (displayln (element-wise-exponentiation tuple1 tuple2))))

(main)

(define (tuple-exponentiation tuple1 tuple2)
  (map (lambda (x y) (expt x y)) tuple1 tuple2))

; Example usage:
; (tuple-exponentiation '(2 3 4) '(5 6 7))
; Expected output: (32 729 16384)

(define (element-wise-exponentiation tuple1 tuple2)
  (map (lambda (x y) (expt x y)) tuple1 tuple2))

(define tuple1 (read))
(define tuple2 (read))
(displayln (element-wise-exponentiation tuple1 tuple2))

; Sample Input-Output Pairs:
; Input:
; 2 3
; 4 5
; Output:
; 8 243

(define (element-wise-exponentiation tuple1 tuple2)
  (map (lambda (x y) (expt x y)) tuple1 tuple2))

; Example usage:
; (element-wise-exponentiation (list 2 3 4) (list 5 6 7))
; Output: (32 729 16384)
